text: Men in general are quick to believe that which they wish to be true.
author: Julius Caesar

text: All men's misfortunes spring from their hatred of being alone.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

text: Why is it that, as a culture, we are more comfortable seeing two men holding guns than holding hands?
author: Ernest Gaines

text: The chief difference between words and deeds is that words are always intended for men for their approbation, but deeds can be done only for God.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: Reasonable men adapt to the world around them unreasonable men make the world adapt to them. The world is changed by unreasonable men.
author: Edwin Louis Cole
